action.action-desc: Mrs. Luna (for herself, Mr. Ogles, Mr. Weber of Texas, and Mr. Rulli) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to modify the eligibility requirements for asylum.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Refugees Using Legal Entry Safely Act or RULES Act.
Section 208(a) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1158(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by amending paragraph (1) to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: Any alien who arrives at a port of entry of the United States, irrespective of such alien's status, may, only at such a port of entry, apply for asylum in accordance with this section or, as applicable, section 235(b).

subparagraph.header: Prohibition on parole or release into the United States
subparagraph.text: Notwithstanding section 236(a)(2), an alien applying for asylum at a port of entry may not be paroled or released into the United States.
in subparagraph (C), by striking Subject to subparagraph (D), paragraph and inserting Paragraph;
in subparagraph (E), by striking Subparagraphs (A) and (B) and inserting Subparagraph (A);
by redesignating subparagraphs (C) and (E) as subparagraphs (B) and (C), respectively; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Effect of apprehension in the United States
subparagraph.text: Paragraph (1) shall not apply to any alien who is apprehended by or referred to the Secretary of Homeland Security as an alien who has entered the United States without inspection and admission or who has remained in the United States beyond the alien's period of authorized stay.

paragraph.text: by striking Attorney General each place it appears and inserting Attorney General or the Secretary of Homeland Security, as applicable,.
